page.title: 06LOUDWATER ESTATE COMPANY
page.content: In{1924}Cameron Jeffs,who owned the {Loudwater}Estate,divided it up into plots and started to sell them for building.When he died,the people who lived there got together and formed the{Loudwater (Troutstream) Estate {Company}who made the rules to preserve the character of the estate and then sold the rest of the plots.One of the architects was{McNamara}who liked {gabled}windows with tiled or thatched curved roofs. Once a year the gates to the estate have to be locked to keep the estate private.Every house has to pay a{road {levy}to pay for any roadworks.The Company has to give permission for any alterations to the buildings. {Muntjac deer}and{foxes}are often seen in gardens.No swings are allowed in gardens without permission.One of the houses is worth {Â£265,000.
